problem.title: CheckPoint: Torque and Angular Impulse
problem.script:
#Enter the computations here m=random.choice([2.0,5.0,8.0]) r=random.choice([0.25,0.45,0.60]) o=random.choice([0.60,2.20,4.80]) w=random.choice([1.60,2.80,3.40])
A= 0.4*( m* r* r)*( o + w) B= 0.1*( m* r* r)*( o + w)
problem.p: A solid sphere of mass m = $m kg and radius r = $r m is spinning about the axis passing through the center of the sphere. At t = 0, the angular speed of the sphere is \(\omega_{0}\) = $o rad/s and the sphere rotates clockwise. At t = 4.0 s, the angular speed is \(\omega \) = $w rad/s and the sphere rotates counterclockwise.
Part A. What is the magnitude of the angular impulse about the center of mass applied to the sphere between t = 0 and t = 4.0 s? Enter the answer in [N.m.s].
Part B. Assuming that the torque about the center of mass applied to the sphere is constant between t = 0 and t = 4.0 s, what is the magnitude of that torque?
